verses.roman:
kiṁ nu te 'viditaṁ nātha
sarva-bhūtātma-sākṣiṇaḥ
kālenāvyāhata-dṛśo
vakṣye 'thāpi tavājñayā

synonyms: kim—what; nu—indeed: te-to You; aviditam—unknown; nātha—O master; sarva—of all; bhūta—beings; ātma—of the intelligence; sākṣiṇaḥ—to the witness; kālena—by time; avyāhata—undisturbed; dṛśaḥ—whose vision; vakṣye—I will speak; atha api—nevertheless; tava—Your; ājñayā—by the order.
translation: What could possibly be unknown to You, O master? With vision undisturbed by time, You witness the minds of all living beings. Nevertheless, on Your order I will speak.

purport.content: Since the Lord knows everything, there is no need to inform Him about anything. Still, to fulfill the Lord's purpose King Nṛga will speak.
